summary: This is an FBI FD-302 form documenting a digital evidence review conducted by CART (Computer Analysis and Response Team) for the Epstein case. It details the quantity of images and videos containing partial or full nudity found on numerous electronic devices, which were marked as 'RESPONSIVE - HIGHLY CONFIDENTIAL' and stored on a specific hard drive at the FBI New York Field Office.

events.title: Digital Evidence Review by CART
events.description: A digital review of evidence processed by CART for images and videos related to the captioned case was conducted. Images and videos containing partial or full nudity were marked 'RESPONSIVE - HIGHLY CONFIDENTIAL'.

locations: New York, New York, United States
keyFacts: A digital review of evidence for the Epstein case (File# SOD-NY-3027571) was conducted, identifying a large volume of images and videos containing nudity.
The review covered numerous electronic devices (e.g., NYC024318, NYC024328, NYC024349, NYC024353), with some containing thousands of responsive images and hundreds of videos.
All responsive material marked 'RESPONSIVE - HIGHLY CONFIDENTIAL' is stored on a 2TB Hard Drive (evidence number 18 136) at the FBI New York Field Office.
The document is an FBI FD-302 form, which is a report of investigation, and contains child victim/witness identity information with restricted disclosure rules.
